en: I think she is showing off her new dress to us.
zh: 我看她是在向我们显摆她的新裙子。

en: She gave us some food.
She gave us something to eat.
She fixed us a snack.
She served us a good meal.
zh: 她请我们吃了一顿大餐。

en: She gave us a present.
She is very kind to us.
She has been a wonderful role model for us.
zh: 她一直是我们的好榜样。

en: She went away without so much as saying good-bye to us.
zh: 她招呼也不打一声就走了。

en: She made coffee for all of us.
zh: 她给我们大家都泡了咖啡。

en: She showed us a beautiful hat.
zh: 她给我们看了一顶漂亮的帽子。

en: She told us an interesting story.
zh: 她给我们讲了一个很有意思的故事。

en: She cooked us a delicious dinner.
zh: 她给我们做了一顿好吃的晚饭。

en: She has done us many kindnesses.
She asked several question of us.
She gave us a vague answer.
zh: 她给了我们一个含糊的回答。

en: She told us not to make a noise.
She was a girl of about our age.
zh: 她是个跟我们差不多大的女孩。

en: She insisted on us going.
She suggested that we should start earlier.
She might know that we are here.
zh: 她可能知道我们在这儿。

en: She is only hard on me.
She accused me of stealing her money.
She got it into her head that I was bad-mouthing her.
zh: 她认定我在背后说她坏话。

en: She demanded that I should help him.
She pointed out the mistakes I had made.
She saw me enter the store.
She went on at me for coming home late.
zh: 她因为我回家晚一直跟我唠叨。

en: She troubled herself to take me to the house I was looking for.
zh: 她费心带我去了我要找的那间屋子。

en: She sang a song, the title of which I did not know.
zh: 她唱了一首歌，我不知道歌名叫什么。

en: She came three minutes after I called.
zh: 我打完电话三分钟她就来了。

en: She got angry about my talk.
She pretended not to hear me.
She insisted that I should pay the bill.
She may have called me up while I was out.
zh: 我不在的时候，她可能给我打过电话。

en: She helped me pack my suitcase.
She was glad of my company.
She insisted on my seeing the doctor.
zh: 她坚持要让我去看医生。

en: She screamed that I was to blame.
She defrauded me of my property.
She was leaving and was walking slowly from me.
zh: 她正要离开，慢悠悠地从我身边走开了。

en: She bled me of all my money.
She cheered me up when I was feeling blue.
zh: 我心情不好的时候，她安慰了我。

en: She took my hint and smiled.
zh: 她领会了我的暗示，笑了。

en: She made a point of my attending the party.
She died before I arrived there.
zh: 我赶到那儿之前，她已经去世了。

en: She looks better today than when I her saw last.
zh: 她今天看起来比我上次见她时好多了。

en: She lost her temper with me when I broke the cup.
zh: 我打破杯子时，她对我发了脾气。

en: She runs faster than I do.
She was scared at the sight of the dead body.
She cherished the memory of her dead husband.
zh: 她一直很怀念她过世的丈夫。

en: She has a claim on her deceased husband's estate.
zh: 她有权继承她去世丈夫的遗产。

en: She shuddered to see the dead cat.
zh: 看到那只死猫，她打了个冷颤。

en: She continued writing in her diary until she died.
zh: 她写日记一直写到去世。

en: She had her first love in her memory until she died.
zh: 她到死都忘不了她的初恋。

en: She cried for hours without ceasing.
zh: 她不停地哭了好几个小时。

en: She refused to accept charity.
She works as an assistant to the manager.
She demanded to see the manager.
She complained to the manager about the service.
zh: 她向经理投诉了服务问题。

en: She pared down her expenditures.
She drummed her fingers on the table.
zh: 她用手指在桌子上敲来敲去。

en: She told her boss what she had in mind.
zh: 她把自己的想法告诉了老板。

en: She told her superior what she thought.
zh: 她向上司说了她的想法。

en: She said she was going to have her own way.
zh: 她说她要按自己的想法来。

en: She dared to call on him.
Does she dare to go into the forest?
She is not scared of taking big risks.
She succeeded in getting herself elected as mayor.
She called the kitten "Jaguar".
She loves her children.
She was standing among children.
She worked hard on account of her children.
zh: 为了孩子，她工作很拼命。

en: She read the children an amusing story.
zh: 她给孩子们读了一个很有趣的故事。

en: She warned the children against playing in the street.
zh: 她告诫孩子们不要在马路上玩。

en: She sat surrounded by her children.
zh: 她坐着，孩子们围在她身边。

en: She is gentle with children.
She looked back on her childhood.
She found it necessary to accustom her child to getting up early.
zh: 她觉得有必要让孩子养成早起的习惯。

en: She brought up her children to be truthful.
zh: 她教导孩子要做诚实的人。

en: She allowed her child to be drowned.
zh: 她眼睁睁地看着孩子淹死了。

en: She put the children to bed.
She took pains to educate her children.
zh: 她费尽心思教育她的孩子。

en: She took great pains to raise her children.
She's good at handling children.
She bribed her child to take the bitter medicine.
zh: 她哄着孩子把苦药喝了。

en: She laid the child down gently.
She committed her child to her aunt's care.
zh: 她把孩子托付给姑妈照顾。

en: She left her children in her aunt's care.
zh: 她把孩子留给姑妈照看。

en: She set a child in the chair.
She coaxed a smile from the baby.
She has given birth to five children.
She liked to take care of the children.
She quit her job to look after her child.
She is busy with the care of her children.
She was ashamed of her children's behavior.
zh: 她为孩子的行为感到羞愧。

en: She cherishes the precious memories of her childhood.
zh: 她非常珍惜童年的美好回忆。

en: She was anxious about her children's health.
You will never know what she went through to educate her children.
zh: 你永远不会知道她为了教育孩子付出了多少。

en: She is careful about her child's nutrition.
She knows well how to deal with children.
zh: 她很擅长跟孩子打交道。

en: She is good with kids.
She has a wonderful hand with children.
She is as simple as a child.
She can't stand being treated like a child.
zh: 她受不了别人把她当小孩子。

en: She was, as many of us were, very shy in her childhood.
zh: 她小时候跟我们很多人一样，也挺害羞的。

en: She gave up everything for her children.
zh: 她为了孩子付出了一切。

en: She seems to have been in poor health in her childhood.
zh: 她小时候身体好像一直不太好。

en: She devoted herself to her children.
zh: 她全身心地投入到了孩子身上。

en: She is devoted to her children.
zh: 她一心都扑在孩子身上。

en: She told the child to eat up the food.
She cannot control her children.
She can't control her children.
She had an itch to see her child.
She bought a toy for her child.
She bought a toy for the kid.
zh: 她给那孩子买了个玩具。

en: She bought a nice toy for her child.
zh: 她给孩子买了个挺棒的玩具。

en: Though she is a child, she can act wisely.
zh: 别看她是个孩子，做事倒挺老练的。

en: Child as she was, she was brave.
zh: 别看她只是个孩子，胆子还挺大。

en: She was a child, but she was brave.
zh: 虽然她那时是个孩子，但她很勇敢。

en: She loved her children alike.
zh: 她对几个孩子都一视同仁。

en: Child as she was, she was not afraid.
zh: 虽说是个孩子，但她一点儿也不害怕。

en: She was a child, but she wasn't afraid.
zh: 她还是个孩子，可她并没害怕。

en: Even though she was a child, she wasn't afraid.
zh: 哪怕她还只是个孩子，她也没害怕。

en: She took pains in educating the children.
zh: 她在教育孩子上费了不少心。

en: She gathered her children about her.
zh: 她把孩子们都叫到自己身边。

en: She participated in the children's games.
zh: 她也参加了孩子们的游戏。

en: She looked after the children.
The behavior of her children in public dismayed her.
zh: 孩子们在公共场合的表现让她感到很心烦。

en: She felt insecure about her children's future.
zh: 她对孩子们的未来感到挺没底的。

en: She always pays attention to her children's behavior.
zh: 她总是很留意孩子们的表现。

en: She spoke to the children in a gentle voice.
zh: 她温柔地跟孩子们说话。

en: She read an amusing story to the children.
zh: 她给孩子们讲了一个挺有趣的故事。

en: She called her children into the room.
zh: 她把孩子们叫进了屋里。

en: She yelled at the children to be quiet.
zh: 她冲孩子们大喊让他们安静点。

en: She made the children clean up their own rooms.
zh: 她让孩子们自己打扫房间。

en: She got the children ready for a walk.
zh: 她帮孩子们准备好出去散步。

en: She was very ambitious for her children.
zh: 她对孩子们的期望非常高。

en: She made cookies for the children.
She told her children to put away their toys.
zh: 她让孩子们把玩具都收好。

en: She told the children an interesting story.
zh: 她给孩子们讲了一个有趣的故事。

en: She called, "Children, come downstairs."
zh: 她喊道：“孩子们，快下楼来。”

en: She watched the children swimming in the pool.
zh: 她看着孩子们在泳池里游泳。

en: She sent her children off to school.
She watched the children going back to school.
zh: 她看着孩子们回学校去。

en: She didn't let her children go out in the rain.
zh: 她没让孩子们去雨里跑。

en: She chided her child for cutting in.
zh: 她责备孩子不该随便插嘴。

en: She braked hard when she saw a child run out into the road.
zh: 看到有小孩冲到马路上，她猛地踩了刹车。

en: She was very embarrassed when her child behaved badly in public.
zh: 孩子在公共场合表现不好，这让她感到很尴尬。

en: She shut the child in his room until he stopped crying.
zh: 她把孩子关在房间里，直到他不哭为止。

en: She is dealing out two apples to each child.
zh: 她给每个孩子分了两个苹果。

en: She tried to break her child of the habit of lying.
zh: 她想改掉孩子撒谎的习惯。

en: She refused to let her child go out in the rain.
She disappeared into thin air.
She disappeared.
She did not turn up.
She is less beautiful than her sister is.
She's not as beautiful as her sister.
She doesn't study as hard as her sister.
She seems short beside her sister.
zh: 她站在姐姐旁边显得挺矮的。

en: She put on her sister's jeans and looked in the mirror.
zh: 她穿上姐姐的牛仔裤照了照镜子。

en: She is no less charming than her sister.
She is not less beautiful than her sister.
zh: 她一点儿也不比她姐姐逊色。

en: She is no less beautiful than her sister is.
She is no less charming than her older sister.
zh: 她和她姐姐一样有魅力。

en: She is no less beautiful than her older sister.
She is different from her sister in every way.
zh: 她跟她姐姐哪儿都不一样。

en: She is less beautiful than her sister.
She wears the same kinds of clothes as her sister.
zh: 她和她姐姐穿衣服是一个风格的。

en: She wears the same kind of clothes as her sister wears.
zh: 她穿的衣服跟她姐姐穿的一个样。

en: She was filled with grief at the news of her sister's death.
zh: 姐姐去世的消息让她悲痛万分。

en: She left home early in the morning for fear that she would miss the first train.
zh: 她一大早就出门了，生怕赶不上头班车。

en: She eats sliced raw fish.
She is out on an errand.
She takes great pleasure in her work.
She went on with the work.
She continued with the work.
She proceeded with the work.
Having done the work, she has nothing to do.
zh: 活干完了，她就没事做了。

en: They say that she quit her job.
She decided to resign her job.
She decided to resign.
She decided to resign from her job.
zh: 她决定不再干这份工作了。

en: She decided to quit her job.
She felt a sigh of relief when she got the work done.
zh: 活干完后，她如释重负地松了口气。

en: She said no more work.
Asked about her job, she said, "My job is too complicated to sum up in a word."
zh: 被问到她的工作时，她说：“我的工作太复杂，一两句话说不清楚。”

en: She was absorbed in her work.
She was engrossed in her work.
She shows a very positive attitude to her work.
zh: 她对待工作的态度非常积极。

en: She's hard at it.
She's at work, isn't she?
She lost interest in her work.
She said that her job gave her a sense of identity.
zh: 她说这份工作让她找到了自我。

en: She's busy with her work.
She is very exact in her job.
She left the office immediately after work.
zh: 她一下班就离开办公室了。

en: She felt a sigh of relief when the work was done.
zh: 活一干完，她就松了口气。

en: It seems that she is not pleased with the job.
zh: 看来她对这工作不太满意。

en: She was eased of her duties.
She died for lack of air.
She went for a walk.
She went out for a walk.
She was in the mood for a walk.
She felt like taking a walk.
She was condemned to lead a miserable life.
She shut an umbrella and began to run.
She has left her umbrella behind.
She was holding an umbrella.
She may have left her umbrella on the bus.
zh: 她可能把伞落在公交车上了。

en: She originated a new way of playing jazz on the shamisen.
zh: 她开创了一种用三味线弹奏爵士乐的新方法。

en: She left home after three days.
She goes to the supermarket every three days.
zh: 她每隔三天去一趟超市。

en: She is devoted to her three children.
zh: 她一心扑在三个孩子身上。

en: She has three brothers.
She is 35 years old and in the prime of life.
She was washing the dishes.
She didn't want to wash the dishes, but she made the best of it.
zh: 她不想洗碗，但还是硬着头皮洗了。

en: She washed the dishes and she dried them.
zh: 她洗了碗并把它们擦干了。

en: She took some meat from the plate.
She is willing to do odd jobs.
It took her more than three months to read through the magazine.
zh: 她花了三个多月才读完那本杂志。

en: She glanced through the magazine.
zh: 她随便翻了翻那本杂志。

en: She should be charged with murder.
She ran for her life to get away from the killer.
zh: 为了躲避杀手，她拼命逃跑。

en: The story goes that she was murdered.
She should have arrived late last night.
zh: 她昨晚深夜应该已经到了。

en: She called me up very late last night.
zh: 她昨晚很晚给我打了个电话。

en: She sat up late last night.
She stayed up late last night.
She tried to kill herself last night.
She passed away peacefully last night.
She caught a cold last night.
She called me at an unearthly hour last night.
zh: 她昨晚半夜三更给我打了个电话。

en: She was robbed of her jewels last night.
She cooked vegetable soup last night.
She cooked us Chinese dishes last night.
zh: 她昨晚给我们做了中餐。

en: She seems to have slept badly last night.
She left the stage last year.
She had one misfortune after another last year.
zh: 她去年倒霉事一桩接一桩。

en: She was born last year.
She traveled around the world last year.
She learned to ride a bicycle last year.
zh: 她去年学会了骑自行车。

en: She first came into contact with Japanese culture last year.
zh: 她去年第一次接触日本文化。

en: She entered this school last year.
zh: 她是去年进这所学校的。

en: She bought some vegetables yesterday.
She bought vegetables yesterday.
She had her hat blown off yesterday.
zh: 昨天她的帽子被风吹走了。

en: She said she was sick yesterday, which was not true.
zh: 她昨天说她病了，其实是骗人的。

en: She didn't go shopping yesterday, did she?
She saw a tall man yesterday.
zh: 她昨天看到个高个子男人。

en: She left Tokyo for New York yesterday.
zh: 她昨天离开东京去纽约了。

en: She seems to have left for Tokyo yesterday.
zh: 她好像昨天动身去东京了。

en: She didn't visit anybody.
She left for Osaka yesterday.
She got a new CD player yesterday.
She was slightly better yesterday.
She must have finished the work yesterday.
zh: 她昨天肯定把活儿干完了。

en: She started for Kyoto yesterday.
She came to see us yesterday.
She practiced her English pronunciation yesterday.
zh: 她昨天练习了英语发音。

en: She played tennis all day yesterday.
zh: 她昨天打了一整天网球。

en: She left for London yesterday.
She is far better today than yesterday.
She did not show up at the party yesterday.
zh: 她昨天没在聚会上露面。

en: She died yesterday afternoon.
She passed away yesterday afternoon.
She didn't show up at the party yesterday.
She had a blue dress on at the party yesterday.
zh: 她昨天在派对上穿了件蓝裙子。

en: She killed herself yesterday.
She committed suicide yesterday.
She went there yesterday.
She has been busy since yesterday.
zh: 她从昨天起就一直挺忙的。

en: She visited at her aunt's yesterday.
She celebrated her fifteenth birthday yesterday.
She went to the hospital yesterday.
She gave him the elbow yesterday.
Did she write in her diary yesterday?
She had nothing to do yesterday.
She is excellent in composition.
She was robbed of her purse.
She earns a living as a writer.
She kept a tight rein on the purse strings.
For all her wealth, she does not look happy.
zh: 虽说她很有钱，但看着并不开心。

en: She was none the happier for her great wealth.
zh: 钱再多她也没觉得更快乐。

en: She was unhappy for all her wealth.
zh: 哪怕很有钱，她也并不快乐。

en: She protested that she had not committed the crime.
She can sew very well.
She is a gifted artist.
zh: 她是个很有天赋的艺术家。

en: She was looking at the fine snow falling on the lake.
zh: 她正看着细雪落在湖面上。

en: She displayed her talents.
She is far from being richly gifted.
She is as clever as she is beautiful.
She tried to keep abreast of the latest fashions.
She didn't like the horse at first.
zh: 她起初并不喜欢那匹马。

en: She had a daughter by her first husband.
zh: 她和第一任丈夫有个女儿。

en: She seems to be nervous about her first class.
zh: 她第一节课好像挺紧张的。

en: She likes nothing but the best.
She endured to the bitter end.
She is thinking of suing as a last resort.
zh: 她在考虑实在不行就打官司。

en: She relied on the medicine as a last resort.
zh: 她实在没办法了才靠那药撑着。

en: She ended up a movie star.
No doubt she will win in the end.
She came last.
She's been feeling a little on edge recently.
zh: 她最近有点心神不宁的。

en: She has recently made remarkable progress in English.
She was tying one on far too often lately.
zh: 她最近喝大醉的次数也太频繁了。

en: She is singing the latest popular songs.
She tries to keep abreast of the latest fashions.
zh: 她总在追赶最新的潮流。

en: She knows much about recent fashions.
zh: 她对最近的流行挺了解的。

en: She knows a lot about the latest fashions.
zh: 她很懂现在的流行趋势。

en: Her health seems to have improved considerably of late.
zh: 她最近身体好像好了不少。

en: She went to apply for a replacement.
She is afraid of falling ill again.
She's afraid of getting sick again.
She made up her mind to try again.
She was never to see her home again.
zh: 她此后再也没能见到她的家乡。

en: She showed them how to fasten their seat belts.
zh: 她教他们怎么系安全带。

en: She is accustomed to sitting.
She is used to sitting.
She sat and smoked.
She sat gazing out of the window.
She is guilty of fraud.
She mistook the sugar for salt.
She refused to drink a cup of coffee with a lot of sugar.
zh: 她不喝加了好多糖的咖啡。

en: She got her left hand burned.
She burned her left hand.
She wore a diamond ring on her left third finger.
zh: 她左手无名指上戴着钻戒。

en: A blister rose on one of her left fingers.
zh: 她左手的一根手指上起了个水泡。

en: She writes with her left hand.
She has an innate love of adventure.
She's die-hard coffee drinker.
She will be happy when she gets engaged.
She was always willing to help people in trouble.
She was always ready to help people in trouble.
zh: 别人有困难她总是随时愿意帮忙。

en: She asked me for help when she was in trouble.
zh: 她遇到困难时找我帮忙。

en: She could always call her parents when she was in a crunch.
zh: 关键时刻她总能找她父母帮忙。

en: She seems to be in trouble. Tell her what to do.
zh: 她好像遇到麻烦了，告诉她该怎么办。

en: She is having dinner now.
She is well off now.
zh: 她现在日子过得挺富裕的。

en: She is off duty tonight.
She is giving a party tonight.
She has to change clothes before tonight's party.
zh: 她在参加今晚的派对前得换身衣服。

en: She is leaving for America tonight.
She may not come to the party tonight.
zh: 她今晚可能不来参加派对了。

en: She is busy at present and can't speak to you.
zh: 她现在正忙，没法跟你说话。

en: She's busy now and can't speak to you.
zh: 她这会儿忙着呢，不能跟你说话。

en: She's busy now and can't talk with you.
zh: 她现在挺忙的，没法跟你聊。

en: She's busy now, so she can't talk with you.
zh: 她现在正忙，所以不能跟你聊。

en: She is appearing on TV tonight.
She will have been married for six years on June 10th of this year.
zh: 到今年6月10号，她结婚就满六年了。

en: Is she going to go to America this year?
She is in hospital now.
She's in the hospital now.
I have an idea she will come today.
I have a feeling that she will come today.
I have a feeling that she'll come today.
zh: 我有预感她今天会过来。

en: She put up the new curtains today.
zh: 她今天把新窗帘挂上了。

en: She is wearing a white dress today.
zh: 她今天穿了一件白裙子。

en: She appears well today.
zh: 她今天看起来气色不错。

en: She feels bad today.
She is heaps better today.
She's a lot better today.
She's much better today.
Her condition is much better today.
She will be coming to see me this afternoon.
She is going to wash the bike this afternoon.
zh: 她今天下午要去洗自行车。

en: Will she be able to finish it today?
She looks very happy today.
zh: 她今天看起来特别开心。

en: Is she any better today?
She did two washes today.
She brought his lunch today.
She fell into a trap in her turn.
zh: 轮到她时，她掉进陷阱里了。

en: She asked me if I would be free next Sunday.
zh: 她问我下周日有没有空。

en: She leaves for New York next Sunday.
She will leave for New York next Sunday.
She will return home next Sunday, that is, the tenth.
zh: 她下周日，也就是十号，会回家。

en: I'm sure that she'll make good in the new job.
zh: 我肯定她能干好这份新工作。

en: She'll be staying at the Royal Hotel next Tuesday.
zh: 她下周二会住在皇家酒店。

en: She will be seventeen years old next February.
zh: 她明年二月就十七岁了。

en: She took a walk with her father this morning.
zh: 她今天早上和她爸爸去散步了。

en: She is now making coffee in the kitchen.
zh: 她现在在厨房煮咖啡呢。

en: She isn't running.
She is now in the prime of womanhood.
She is doing her homework now.
She is writing a letter now.
She will be in Paris by now.
zh: 她现在应该已经到巴黎了。

en: I'm sure she has got to the village by this time.
zh: 我肯定她这会儿已经到村子里了。

en: I'm sure that she has arrived at the village by now.
zh: 我确信她现在已经到那个村子了。

en: She is going to have a baby this month.
She is coming home at the end of this month.
She is now in a low frame of mind.
She is now in danger.
She is working hard this semester.
zh: 她这学期学习挺努力的。

en: She is out now.
She left home just now.
She is forbidden to go out.
She's not at home now.
She isn't at home now.
She may not be at home now.
She knows what to do now.
zh: 她现在知道该做什么了。

en: What do you figure she is doing now?
zh: 你觉得她现在在干嘛呢？

en: What do you think she is doing now?
zh: 你觉得她现在在做什么？

en: She is living in London.
Now she is out of my reach.
She's still active in the front lines.
She is as beautiful a model as I have ever seen.
zh: 她是我见过最美的模特了。

en: She has as fine a figure as I have ever seen.
zh: 她的身材是我见过最好的。

en: She has never fallen in love.
She had never seen New York before.
She looked more beautiful than ever.
zh: 她看起来比以往任何时候都漂亮。

en: She has always been at the head of her class.
zh: 她一直是班里的第一名。

en: She is in her hotel now.
She's at the hotel now.
She lives in comfort now.
She is wearing a nice dress now.
zh: 她现在穿着一件漂亮的连衣裙。

en: She is practicing the violin now.
She is all right at the moment.
She is being quiet for the moment.
She was on verge of fainting.
She was on the verge of crying.
Where does she live now?
She still alleges innocence.
zh: 她还是坚称自己是清白的。

en: Does she still want to take part in the party?
zh: 她还想参加那个派对吗？

en: She is now well enough to wash her hair by herself.
zh: 她现在好多了，能自己洗头了。

en: She is now an utter stranger to me.
zh: 她现在对我来说完全是个陌生人。

en: She's married and settled down now.
She is better off than she was when I met her last.
zh: 她现在过得比我上次见她时好多了。

en: She is now involved in tennis.
She's hard at it now.
She won't come just yet.
She went out just now.
She isn't lonely now.
She ought to have arrived by now.
zh: 她这会儿应该已经到了。

en: She should have arrived home by now.
zh: 她这会儿应该已经到家了。

en: I think she's probably waiting at the station now.
zh: 我觉得她现在可能在车站等着。

en: She may be waiting at the station now.
zh: 她现在可能在车站等吧。

en: She is having coffee now.
She is in the bloom of youth.
She is rather cross now.
She's in a fairly bad mood now.
She is now staying at her uncle's house.
She is busy preparing supper now.
She is said to be in hospital now.
I hear that she's in the hospital now.
zh: 我听说她现在在医院里。

en: She is at work right now.
She is seeing a Kabuki play now.
zh: 她现在在看歌舞伎表演。

en: She has a great love for antique goods.
She loves antiques.
She really likes antiques.
She bent down.
She is wearing a leather belt around her waist.
She girded her waist with a belt.
She was frightened to see the black cat.
zh: 看到那只黑猫，她被吓了一跳。

en: She was dressed in black.
She is very becoming in a black party dress.
zh: 她穿那件黑色晚礼服挺漂亮的。

en: She was dressed all in black.
She is recognized as the best figure-skater in the country.
zh: 她被公认为国内最棒的花滑选手。

en: She has international renown as a painter.
zh: 作为画家，她在国际上很有名。

en: She is going to have an international marriage.
She has traveled in foreign parts.
She has traveled in foreign countries.
She laid down her life for her country.
She was dressed in rich silks.
zh: 她穿着华丽的丝绸衣服。

en: She gave me a haughty look and walked away.
zh: 她傲慢地瞥了我一眼就走了。

en: She is a high-liver.
She went to Takasu clinic.
She went to the Takasu clinic.
"Was she a high school student?" "Yes, she was."
She was shy in her high school days.
zh: 她高中的时候挺害羞的。

en: She was good at mathematics in high school.
She has changed a lot since high school.
zh: 自从高中毕业，她变了很多。

en: She has expensive tastes in cars.
zh: 她对车的眼光很高，喜欢名贵的。

en: She is a woman of noble birth.
She was born with a silver spoon in her mouth.
zh: 她是含着金汤匙出生的。

en: She didn't factor the high cost of repairs into the budget.
zh: 她没把高昂的修理费算进预算。

en: She is wearing an expensive necklace.
zh: 她戴着一条昂贵的项链。

en: She is wearing a valuable ring.
zh: 她戴着一枚很值钱的戒指。

en: Though she did not wear expensive clothes, she was neatly dressed.
zh: 虽然没穿名贵的衣服，但她穿得很整洁。

en: She can jump high.
She was too heavy on the perfume.
She was absent from lectures.
She has many friends in Hong Kong.
She went into the woods in search of her lost child.
zh: 她进树林去找失踪的孩子了。

en: She is active.
She is honest in deeds and in words.
She is quite decent in conduct.
She has gone, but I still love her.
She has gone, I feel like crying.
She decided to go.
She has gone out.
She was asked to go, and she left accordingly.
zh: 有人叫她走，她也就走了。

en: She had a choice of going or remaining.
She deliberated over whether to go or stay.
She took a book at random from the shelf.
zh: 她从书架上随手拿了一本书。

en: She was in a position to decide where to go.
She did not want to go, but her father made her go.
zh: 她不想去，但她爸爸非让她去。

en: She wanted to go, and her father let her go.
zh: 她想去，她爸爸就让她去了。

en: She decided not to go.
She bought a tea set.
She ordered a cup of tea.
She squeezed a lemon for tea.
She left her room in haste.
zh: 她急急忙忙地离开了房间。

en: She is widely known.
She swam across the wide river.
zh: 她游过了那条宽宽的河。

en: She was dropped from the height of happiness into the depth of misery.
zh: 她从幸福的巅峰跌到了痛苦的深渊。

en: She is babbling with happiness.
zh: 她高兴得在那儿说个不停。

en: She is drunk with happiness.
She became happy.
She lived a happy life.
She said that she had been happy.
zh: 她说她以前过得挺开心的。

en: There was a happy twinkle in her eyes.
zh: 她眼里透着开心的劲儿。

en: She seems to be happy.
She had the good fortune to get into the school she wanted to.
zh: 她运气不错，考上了想上的学校。

en: It seems that she's happy.
She must be on cloud nine.
She must be very happy.
She looks happy.
She had a happy childhood.
I don't think she is happy.
She is happy.
She says that she is happy.
She seems to have been happy.
Luckily she won a scholarship.
He took advantage of the good weather to do some gardening.
zh: 他趁着天气好在园子里干点活。

en: She made nothing of her opportunities.
zh: 她根本没把那些机会当回事。

en: She was so curious that she opened the box.
zh: 她太好奇了，就把盒子打开了。

en: She has begun to play tennis not so much out of curiosity as out of vanity.
zh: 她开始打网球与其说是出于好奇，不如说是虚荣心作祟。

en: She did so out of curiosity.
She likes to eat fresh raw vegetables.
zh: 她喜欢吃新鲜的生蔬菜。

en: She's looking the other way.
She seems to be having a good feed over there.
She was beside herself with anger after the argument.
There was much lipstick on her lips.
She pressed her lips firmly together.
She is a chatterbox.
She was late because of the heavy traffic.
She ran across her old friend while walking in the park.
zh: 她在公园散步时碰到了老朋友。

en: She was none the worse for the traffic accident.
She lost her memory in a traffic accident.
zh: 她在一次车祸中失忆了。

en: She was injured in the traffic accident.
She took night classes in the science of self-defense.
She dropped lemon juice into her tea.
zh: 她往茶里滴了点柠檬汁。

en: She broke a vase by mistake.
zh: 她不小心打碎了一个花瓶。

en: When she said "I missed you" she began to cry.
zh: 当她说“我想你了”的时候，她哭了出来。

en: She looked behind.
She may realize later on what I meant.
zh: 她以后可能会明白我的意思。

en: She may realize later what I meant.
zh: 她以后可能会明白我什么意思。

en: She added, as an afterthought, that she was going to do some shopping.
zh: 她随后又补了一句，说她要去买点东西。

en: She says she will call you later.
zh: 她说她待会儿给你打电话。

en: She studied English in the morning.
She was there in the morning.
She got up at seven in the morning.
She was there all morning.
She has to go shopping in the afternoon.
She called me in the afternoon.
She was occupied in cooking all afternoon.
zh: 她一下午都在忙着做饭。

en: She spent all afternoon cooking.
zh: 她花了一下午的时间做饭。

en: She practices the piano in the afternoon or in the evening.
zh: 她要么下午练琴，要么晚上练琴。

en: She will be back at five.
She is five years old.
She had not been employed two months when her ability was recognized.
zh: 她才工作不到两个月，能力就得到了认可。

en: She was watching the dead leaves falling.
She was watching the dead leaves fall.
She ached for home.
She was homesick.
She broke the window on purpose.
zh: 她是故意把窗户弄破的。

en: She told me a wrong address on purpose.
zh: 她故意给了我个错地址。

en: She told me the wrong address on purpose.
zh: 她是故意告诉错我地址的。

en: She bolted the doors and windows.
She tried to open the door, which she found impossible.
zh: 她想开门，发现根本打不开。

en: She pushed the door shut.
She pulled the door open.
She led a solitary life.
She pressed her lips together and willed herself not to cry.
zh: 她抿着嘴，强忍着不哭出来。

en: She is a woman with a classical education.
zh: 她是个受过古典教育的女性。

en: She was called away to the party.
She turned against her old friend.
She left the old newspapers lying in a heap.
zh: 她把旧报纸堆在那儿没管。

en: She is ashamed of her old clothes.
zh: 她嫌自己的旧衣服丢人。

en: She took off her old shoes and put on the new ones.
zh: 她脱下旧鞋，换上了新的。

en: She sat on a bench, humming an old melody in a low voice.
zh: 她坐在长椅上，低声哼着一支老曲子。

en: She wanted to replace her old vase with a new one.
zh: 她想把旧花瓶换个新的。

en: She turned her old dress into a skirt.
zh: 她把旧连衣裙改成了半身裙。

en: She had an individual style of speaking.
She's an individualist.
She has a strong personality.
She is rough in speech.
Words failed her.
She studies literature as well as language.
zh: 她既研究语言也研究文学。

en: She pretended illness as an excuse.
She is among the best artists of today.
zh: 她是当今最优秀的艺术家之一。

en: She is in conference now.
She is quite satisfied with her life as it is.
She failed to appear.
She had left the front door unlocked.
She swept the dirt from the porch.
zh: 她把门廊上的灰土扫干净了。

en: She got on a bus for Harajuku.
zh: 她上了去原宿的公交车。

en: She's getting on all right.
She went on picnic in spirits.
zh: 她兴高采烈地去野餐了。

en: She isn't as energetic as she once was.
zh: 她不像以前那么有活力了。

en: She had the wisdom to follow the custom.
zh: 她很明智，懂得入乡随俗。

en: She put the key in her pocket.
She is wise and you are no less so.
She was too wise not to understand what you meant.
zh: 她那么聪明，不可能不明白你的意思。

en: She was conscious of being stared at by a stranger.
zh: 她感觉到有个陌生人在盯着她看。

en: She started talking with a stranger.
zh: 她跟一个陌生人聊了起来。

en: She is not as young as she looks.
She is fond of display.
She is open to people who have a different point of view.
zh: 她很能听取不同的意见。

en: She's just putting up a front.
She is much cleverer than she looks.
She's a lot smarter than she looks.
She spoke English to me just to show off.
zh: 她跟我说英语纯粹是为了显摆。

en: She is persistent though she doesn't look so.
zh: 她虽然看着不显，但挺有毅力的。

en: She quickly put the money out of sight.
She was breathing hard.
She gave a shrug of the shoulders.
She is absorbed in her study.
She was not in the mood for serious books.
zh: 她没心思看那些太严肃的书。

en: She is deep in study.
She waited on her sick father hand and foot.
zh: 她无微不至地侍奉着生病的父亲。

en: She went out with her dog.
She is afraid of dogs.
She will take her dog to the river.
She made a face when she saw a dog.
zh: 她一看见狗就撇了撇嘴。

en: She told me that she wanted a pet dog.
zh: 她跟我说她想养只宠物狗。

en: She is very much afraid of dogs.
She can drive a car.
She forgot to feed her dog.
She is much afraid of dogs.
She's very afraid of dogs.
She takes a walk with her dog.
She banged the table with her fist.
zh: 她用拳头狠狠砸了下桌子。

en: She was busy doing her hair.
She is just started for your house.
She married Hiroshi against her will.
She sat on a hard chair.
She is concerned with health foods.
She quit school for health reasons.
zh: 她因为健康原因退学了。

en: She worked at the cost of her health.
zh: 她拼命工作，结果累坏了身体。

en: She moved to a warmer place for the sake of her health.
zh: 为了养身体，她搬到了一个暖和的地方。

en: She gave birth to a healthy baby.
She was bursting with health.
She is really in good health.
She could not help thinking that health is important.
zh: 她忍不住觉得健康真重要。

en: She gave birth on Monday to her first child.
zh: 她周一生下了第一个孩子。

en: She doesn't get paid by the month, but by the day.
zh: 她不是拿月薪，是按天领工资的。

en: She turned off the lights so she could enjoy the moonlight.
zh: 她把灯关了，好赏赏月亮。

en: She writes to me once a month.
zh: 她每个月都给我写封信。

en: She writes to her pen pal in London twice a month.
zh: 她每个月给伦敦的笔友写两次信。

en: She turned away in horror at the sight of blood.
zh: 她一见血就吓得把脸扭开了。

en: She fainted when she saw blood.
She felt faint at the sight of blood.
zh: 她一看到血就觉得头晕。

en: She was a Brown before her marriage.
She was a Brown before she got married.
She was a Smith before her marriage.
She was a Smith before she got married.
She blames me for the fact that our married life isn't going well.
zh: 她把我们婚后生活不顺都怪到我头上。

en: She was dressed all in white for the wedding.
zh: 婚礼那天她穿了一身白。

en: She was a bridesmaid at the wedding.
She is dependent on her parents even after her marriage.
zh: 她都结婚了还依赖父母。

en: She refuses to abandon her career for marriage.
zh: 她不愿为了结婚放弃事业。

en: She is too young to marry.
She's too young to get married.
She is not about to get married.
She's not the marrying type.
zh: 她不是那种想成家的人。

en: I have half a mind to marry her.
Her marriage brought happiness to her parents.
zh: 她结婚成家让她父母很高兴。

en: She went to college after she got married.
zh: 她结了婚才去上的大学。

en: I wonder if she is married.
She isn't married.
Is she married?
She will be happy when she gets married.
zh: 她结婚了肯定会幸福的。

en: She is disposed to get married.
I hope to marry her.
She didn't come after all.
She ended up getting married to him.
zh: 她最后还是跟他结婚了。

en: She didn't buy the ticket after all.
She went back to England in the end.
She didn't telephone after all.
She did not turn up after all.
She was satisfied with the result.
She is by no means polite.
She is no ordinary student.
zh: 她可不是个普通的学生。

en: She is by no means beautiful.
She can never keep a secret.
She is by no means angelic.
She is far from honest.
She was by no means happy.
zh: 她当时一点儿也不开心。

en: She is no stranger to me.
She is never late for school.
She is proud of never having been late for school.
zh: 她以自己上学从没迟到过为荣。

en: She is anything but a singer.
zh: 她哪儿算得上是个歌手啊。

en: She is by no means selfish.
She is by no means stupid.
She protested to me that she had never done such a thing.
zh: 她向我辩解说她从来没干过那种事。

en: She would by no means tell a lie.
I cannot help loving her in spite of her many faults.
zh: 虽然她缺点很多，我还是忍不住爱她。

en: I like her all the better for her faults.
zh: 正因为她那些缺点，我反而更喜欢她了。

en: She is none the less beautiful for her faults.
zh: 她虽然有缺点，但一点儿也不影响她的美。

en: She was fired on the grounds that she was often absent.
zh: 她因为经常缺勤被开除了。

en: She was beside herself with rage.
She cried and cried, but no one came to comfort her.
zh: 她哭个不停，但没一个人来安慰她。

en: Overwork caused her to be absent from work for a week.
zh: 她因为工作过劳，一周没上班。

en: She inquired directions from the policeman.
She asked the police for protection.
She was arrested by the police.
I think she is withholding information from the police.
zh: 我觉得她对警察隐瞒了情况。

en: She altered her plans.
She directed the planning of the project.
zh: 她负责这个项目的规划。

en: She majored in economics.
She absented herself from the lesson.
She works as hard as her siblings.
zh: 她干活跟她兄弟姐妹一样卖力。

en: She adores her elder brother.
She adores her older brother.
She said to her brother, "I will tell on you."
zh: 她对她哥说：“我要去告你的状。”

en: She visited her husband in prison.
zh: 她去监狱里看了她老公。

en: Does she know you?
She is two years older than you.
She has not so much patience as you.
She doesn't have as much patience as you do.
She is contemptuous of your ambition.
She is anxious about your health.
She has anxiety for your safety.
She will be a good companion for you.
She did so for her own sake, not for your sake.
zh: 她这样做是为了她自己，不是为了你。

en: She knows your mother very well.
My sister has three times as many books as I do.
zh: 我姐姐的书是我的三倍。

en: She has three times as many dictionaries as you do.
Did she show you the picture?
zh: 她给你看那张照片了吗？

en: She is as tall as you.
She is almost as tall as you.
She left here long before you arrived.
zh: 你还没来呢，她就早就走了。

en: She is not such a girl as you imagine.
zh: 她不是你想象中的那种女孩。

en: She is not what you suppose her to be.
She is not the kind of person you think she is.
She is not what you think she is.
She froze at the sight of the bear.
She bought two pairs of socks.
She mended her socks.
She manages a shoe store.
She had her shoes shined.
She laced her shoes.
She spends a lot of money on shoes.
She was hungry enough to eat anything.
She looked up at the sky.
She parked her car in a vacant lot.
zh: 她把车停在了一片空地上。

en: She must have been sick.
Her hair grayed with suffering.
zh: 受了这些罪，她的头发都白了。

en: She was racked with pain.
She had no difficulty in learning the poem by heart.
zh: 她背这首诗一点都不费劲。

en: She screamed in agony.
She is away in Kyushu.
She got on the subway at Ginza.
She continued her job in the bank.
She married a bank clerk.
zh: 她嫁给了一个银行职员。

en: She intended to withdraw all her savings from the bank.
zh: 她打算把银行里的积蓄全取出来。

en: She drew out the money from the bank.
zh: 她把钱从银行取了出来。

en: She covers Wall Street.
zh: 她负责报道华尔街的新闻。

en: She is always thinking of moneymaking schemes.
zh: 她整天净琢磨着怎么赚钱。

en: She thinks of nothing but making money.
She was a girl with golden hair.
She is a blonde girl.
She screamed and fainted.
She married a rich old man.
zh: 她嫁给了一个有钱的老头。

en: She was married to a rich man.
She married a rich merchant.
She was brought up in a rich family.
zh: 她是在富裕家庭长大的。

en: She taught rich Indian girls.
zh: 她教过印度的富家女孩。

en: She seems rich.
For all her riches, she's not happy.
zh: 尽管她很有钱，但她并不开心。

en: She married a rich man.
She is a wealthy woman.
She's rich.
She is rich, and what is better, very beautiful.
zh: 她很有钱，而且更棒的是，她还长得很漂亮。

en: She must have been rich.
She is said to have been rich.
It is said that she is rich.
Rich as she is, she is not happy.
zh: 虽说她有钱，但她过得并不快乐。

en: She is rich but he is poor.
She is rich, but he is twice as rich.
zh: 她挺有钱的，但他比她还要富一倍。

en: She is not rich enough to waste money.
zh: 她还没富到可以随便乱花钱的地步。

en: She paid to attend the concert.
zh: 她是花钱买票听的音乐会。

en: She liked throwing her money about.
She knows the art of making money.
zh: 她很有一套赚钱的法子。

en: She tried to touch the golden crane.
She refused to take the money.
She only worked for the sake of money.
She had an unnatural desire for money.
zh: 她对金钱有着不寻常的渴望。

en: She buys what she wants regardless of the cost.
zh: 她想买什么就买什么，根本不看价格。

en: She is badly off.
She thinks money and happiness are the same.
zh: 她觉得金钱就等于幸福。

en: Her lack of money kept her from going with me.
zh: 因为没钱，她没法跟我一起去。

en: She didn't have any money, so she couldn't go with me.
zh: 她没钱，所以没法跟我一起去。

en: She took a typical example of modern music.
zh: 她举了一个现代音乐的典型例子。

en: She attracted all the young men in the neighborhood.
zh: 附近的年轻人都被她迷住了。

en: She fell into conversation with her neighbors.
She shops at a local grocer.
zh: 她在附近的杂货店买东西。

en: She was different from most women in the neighborhood, for she was able to read and write.
zh: 她和附近的大多数妇女不同，因为她识字。

en: She has put on weight recently.
She keeps him at arm's length these days.
She is going to learn how to drive.
She wants to extend the no-smoking area.
She broke herself of the habit of smoking.
She gave up smoking.
She quit smoking.
She has a well-proportioned figure.
She's accounted diligent.
zh: 大家都觉得她挺勤快的。

en: She was astonishingly beautiful.
She looked stupefied in amazement.
She forgave me for breaking her mirror.
zh: 她原谅了我打碎她的镜子。

en: She looked at herself in the mirror.
She stood before the mirror.
She stood in front of the mirror.
She stopped before the mirror to admire herself.
zh: 她停在镜子前欣赏自己。

en: She was brushing her hair in front of a mirror.
She smiled at herself in the mirror.
zh: 她对着镜子里的自己笑了笑。

en: She saw herself in the mirror.
zh: 她在镜子里看到了自己。

en: She turned over the page with excitement.
She jumped about in excitement.
She looked excited.
Aside from fright she was not injured.
zh: 除了受了点惊吓，她没受伤。

en: She was only frightened, not injured.
She heaved her chest.
She read the letter with her heart beating fast.
zh: 她心跳加快地读着那封信。

en: She felt her heart turn over in her chest.
She pressed the child to her breast.
zh: 她把孩子紧紧搂在怀里。

en: Her viewpoint is limited.
She can only view things in a narrow scope.
She committed suicide by jumping off the bridge.
She wants to engage in teaching.
She went into teaching.
She was standing in the front of the classroom.
She earns her living by teaching.
She looks like a teacher.
She will be a teacher.
She isn't cut out for teaching.
She sat beside me in church.
zh: 在教堂里，她坐在我旁边。

en: She emphasized the importance of education.
zh: 她强调了教育的重要性。

en: She adapted her teaching method to slow learners.
zh: 她针对学得慢的学生调整了教学方法。

en: She laughed to cover her fear.
She uttered a scream of terror.
zh: 她发出一声惊恐的尖叫。

en: She looks pale with fear.
She turned pale with fear.
She screamed with terror.
Fear fell upon her.
She fainted with fear.
She went crazy with fear.
She was pale with fear.
She threw her arms around him in horror.
zh: 她吓坏了，一把抱住了他。

en: She was trembling with fear.
She trembled with fear.
Her hair stood on end at the sight of the horrible accident.
zh: 看到那场可怕的事故，她吓得汗毛都竖起来了。

en: She was scared to cross the road.
She was afraid to cross the road.
She looked away terrified.
She was afraid to pass through the woods.
She forced me to go out with her.
zh: 她硬拉着我跟她一起出去。

en: She was dumb with fear.
She is obstinate.
She's stubborn.
She is stubborn.
She had her hat blown off by the strong wind.
zh: 大风把她的帽子吹跑了。

en: She's a woman of strong character.
She was none the worse for drinking spirits.
zh: 她喝了烈酒倒也没事儿。

en: She ran second.
She was from Kyoto, as was evident from her accent.
zh: 听口音就知道她是京都人。

en: She went to Kyoto, didn't she?
She will visit her uncle in Kyoto next week.
zh: 她下周要去京都看她叔叔。

en: She visited not only Kyoto but also Nara.
zh: 她不仅去了京都，还去了奈良。

en: She fried fish in salad oil.
She's only interested in fish and cockroaches.
zh: 她只对鱼和蟑螂感兴趣。

en: She hates fish and never eats any.
She hung a little Picasso on the wall of the drawing room.
zh: 她在客厅墙上挂了一幅毕加索的小画。

en: She married him last year.
She was out of Japan last year.
She graduated from high school last year.
She got married last year.
She can't do without milk.
As soon as she got her salary, she spent it all.
zh: 她一领工资就全花光了。

en: She gets a high salary.
She gets paid a lot.
She invited two of her classmates - Jane and Mary.
zh: 她请了两个同学，简和玛丽。

en: She steeled herself not to cry.
zh: 她强忍着不让自己哭出来。

en: She kept on crying.
She began crying.
She started to cry.
She started crying.
She began to cry.
She is calm now; she has stopped crying.
In tears, she tore up his letter and threw it away.
zh: 她流着泪把他的信撕碎扔了。

en: She felt like crying.
She choked her utterance with sobs.
She tried not to cry.
zh: 她努力不让自己哭出来。

en: She tried in vain not to cry.
zh: 她想憋住不哭，可还是没忍住。

en: She was watching the film with her eyes red in tears.
She does nothing but cry.
She kissed away the boy's tears.
She made her crying baby drink some milk.
zh: 她给哭闹的宝宝喂了点奶。

en: She cried.
Her proficiency in English rapidly improved.
zh: 她的英语水平进步飞快。

en: She was aging quickly.
She flared up with anger.
She burst into laughter.
She suddenly burst in on our conversation.
zh: 她突然插话，打断了我们的谈话。

en: She broke into tears.
She broke away crying.
She could not help bursting into tears.
She is apt to fits of depression.
She cleaned her room in a hurry.
zh: 她急急忙忙打扫了房间。

en: She came hurrying to his bedside.
zh: 她急忙赶到他的病床前。

en: She came around to my house.
She quickly went up the stairs.
She hastened to deny the story.
zh: 她赶紧否认了那个说法。

en: She guided me to the palace.
She talked her husband into having a holiday in France.
zh: 她说服丈夫去法国度假。

en: She will often go shopping on holidays.
She is now on vacation.
She came over to France for a holiday.
She spent a good deal of money on her vacation.
She is impatient for her holidays.
She was taken ill on holiday and had to find a doctor.
zh: 她度假时生病了，还得去看医生。

en: She was taken ill on holiday.
She was out of breath from walking up and down hills.
She stood on her head.
She gave her guests a hearty reception.
She is careful about the way she receives guests.
She showed the visitor her baby.
zh: 她给访客看了她的宝宝。

en: She cleaned her room before her guests arrived.
zh: 客人来之前，她打扫了房间。

en: She put her room in order before her guests arrived.
zh: 客人来之前，她把房间收拾好了。

en: She was prohibited from smoking.
She has a bad habit of smoking.
She argues for the sake of arguing.
She argues just for the sake of arguing.
She addressed herself to the chairperson.
She talked to the chairman.
She talked to the chairperson.
She was named as chairman.
She was appointed chairperson.
She performed her duties.
She regarded me suspiciously.
She was driven to stealing by hunger.
zh: 她是因为饿极了才去偷东西的。

en: She had bright black eyes.
zh: 她有一双明亮的黑眼睛。

en: She dreaded having to tell him what had happened.
zh: 她害怕告诉他发生了什么事。

en: She got up late.
She bore the air of a lady.
She looked puzzled at the abrupt question posed by a reporter.
zh: 记者的突然提问让她一脸困惑。

en: She looked at the picture to refresh her memory.
zh: 她看着照片，想唤起记忆。

en: She's good at getting around rules.
She felt sick and sank to the ground.
zh: 她觉得不舒服，瘫倒在了地上。

en: She looks bad-tempered, but she is kind at heart.
zh: 她看着脾气挺大，其实心肠挺好的。

en: It is difficult for us to get along with her, because she is hard to please.
zh: 我们挺难跟她相处的，因为她这人太难伺候了。

en: She almost passed out.
She is a girl full of sentiment.
zh: 她是个挺多愁善感的女孩。

en: She pulled herself together and started to talk again.
zh: 她振作了一下，又开始说话了。

en: She fell down senseless on the floor.
zh: 她晕倒在地上，失去了知觉。

en: She fainted but came to in about 5 minutes.
zh: 她晕倒了，但大概五分钟后就醒了。

en: She fainted but came to after a few minutes.
zh: 她晕倒了，不过几分钟后就醒过来了。

en: She fainted, but came to after a few minutes.
zh: 她晕了过去，但几分钟后就缓过来了。

en: She was in a sad state.
zh: 她那时候样子挺凄惨的。

en: She struck me as a tactful girl.
zh: 我觉得她是个处事挺得体的女孩。

en: She passed right by me without noticing.
zh: 她直接从我身边走过去，根本没注意到我。

en: She has a friendly appearance.
It appears that she might change her mind.
zh: 看来她可能会改变主意。

en: A quick temper is the only defect in her character.
zh: 她性格里唯一的缺点就是脾气太急。

en: She is aggressive.
She's assertive.
She's strong-willed.
She was robbed of her money on her way home.
zh: 她在回家路上被抢了钱。

en: She went home.
She scolded her daughter for coming home too late.
zh: 她因为女儿回来太晚而教训了她一顿。

en: She could not find her way back.
She showed a great deal of wit in handling the delicate question.
zh: 在处理那个棘手的问题时，她表现得非常机智。

en: She was in a bad mood; she must have been put off by something that had happened before I arrived.
zh: 她心情不太好，肯定是在我来之前被什么事儿给扫了兴。

en: She is in a temper, because she missed her usual train in the subway and had to walk to work.
zh: 她正发火呢，因为没赶上平时那班地铁，只能走路去上班。

en: She is in a bad mood.
She took full advantage of the opportunity.
zh: 她充分利用了这个机会。

en: She earned remarkable grades at the final exams.
zh: 她期末考试考得特别好。

en: She's working on a term paper.
Expectation caused her to be flushed with excitement.
zh: 这种期待让她兴奋得满脸通红。

en: She knew the story already.
zh: 她已经知道那个故事了。

en: It seemed that she had already received the money.
zh: 好像她已经收到那笔钱了。

en: She removed the papers from the desk.
zh: 她把桌上的文件拿走了。

en: She found her purse under the desk.
zh: 她在桌子底下找到了她的钱包。

en: She looks unhappy.
She doesn't seem happy.
She dreamed a strange dream.
She had a strange hat on.
zh: 她戴着一顶奇怪的帽子。

en: She came out with some strange tunings.
zh: 她哼了几个奇怪的调子。

en: She was all smiles.
She gladly accepted his proposal.
zh: 她欣然接受了他的提议。

en: She danced with joy.
She was only too glad to help us.
She is willing to do anything for me.
One moment she was happy, the next she was sad.
zh: 她一会儿高兴，一会儿又难过了。

en: She fairly jumped for joy.
zh: 她简直高兴得跳了起来。

en: She was full of joy.
Her heart was filled with joy.
She is beside herself with joy.
